trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SEQ_00<tab>Alisaie is inclined to keep a close eye on the queen.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Sphene.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Sphene again.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Sphene once more.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ALISAIE_000_001<tab>Well, having established that we should be wary, we could use more information.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ALISAIE_000_002<tab>So let's head to this place, the outskirts, and see what we can learn. Perhaps about Sphene, as well.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_010<tab>I trust you have similar farming facilities in Tural?
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_011<tab>They're completely different from ours. I've got no idea what all those machines do.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_012<tab>We settled on this approach after some trial and error. The Turali have their own methods of farming, which they wanted to continue employing.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_013<tab>But the environment makes it challenging. There's too much rain and not enough light.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_100_013<tab>Thankfully, the use of electrope has allowed us to fortify the buildings here, as well as provide what nature cannot.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_014<tab>Electro-what...?
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_015<tab>Electrope. It's a material we use for myriad devices and applications.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_016<tab>A topic for another time, perhaps. If you would follow me, we're nearly to the outskirts.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_KRILE_000_020<tab>A most unusual farm, but the produce appears normal enough.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_025<tab>Have you ever seen such strange contraptions? I wonder what this one is used for.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ALISAIE_000_030<tab>It's a relief to see the people here are well, at least.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_GRAHATIA_000_035<tab>The innovations of Alexandria are nothing short of extraordinary.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>Those brick buildings... I've seen their like before, though I cannot remember where.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_KRILE_000_050<tab>It's a rather lively settlement, isn't it? In defiance of this ceaseless gloom, almost.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_055<tab>It's a relief to see the people here are well. Hopefully the same can be said for everyone in Yyasulani.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ALISAIE_000_060<tab>I'll admit, I've seen nothing particularly suspicious. Yet.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_GRAHATIA_000_065<tab>It's fascinating how they've combined traditional bricklaying with electrope-based engineering. A curious blending of two cultures.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_ERENVILLE_000_070<tab>This is a Tonawawtan village. Or at least, it was. Before the dome and these strange contraptions.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_080<tab>Electrope has done much to improve the efficiency of their farming, but hasn't replaced everything.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_081<tab>The people wanted to preserve their old way of life, and we did not want to force ours upon them.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_082<tab>You went to such lengths so that our cultures could coexist. Even going so far as to learn our tongue... I'm sure everyone appreciated that.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_083<tab>Communication was thankfully not an issue, for the Turali tongue is surprisingly similar to Alexandrian.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_084<tab>Of course, there are words and phrases for which there is no equivalent, but those can be taught with minimal effort.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_085<tab>Through mutual respect, understanding, and patience, we Alexandrians and Turali have learned a great deal from one another.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_SPHENE_000_086<tab>And I am sure there is much you wish to learn as well. So please, if you have questions, do not hesitate to ask.
TEXT_KINGMD117_04928_WUKLAMAT_000_090<tab>Touring farmlands with the queen of another nation is not how I expected to spend my day.
